Package edu.uky.cs.nil.sabre.etree

Class BooleanEventTree<E extends Event>

java.lang.Object
edu.uky.cs.nil.sabre.etree.EventTree<E>
edu.uky.cs.nil.sabre.etree.BranchingEventTree<E>
edu.uky.cs.nil.sabre.etree.BooleanEventTree<E>
Type Parameters:
E - the type of event in this tree
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public class BooleanEventTree<E extends Event> extends BranchingEventTree<E>
A branching event tree whose expression is of type boolean and will have three possible branches: one where the expression is false, one where the expression is true, and the irrelevant branch.

Boolean event trees can be used for numeric preconditions. An event tree's expression cannot be of type number, because the tree must have a branch for every possible value of the expression, and there are infinitely many numbers, however preconditions on numeric values, like (n > 5), are of type boolean, so they can be the expression for a Boolean event tree.

Author:
Stephen G. Ware

  • Constructor Details

    • BooleanEventTree

      public BooleanEventTree(ImmutableSet<E> events, Expression expression, EventTree<E> falseBranch, EventTree<E> trueBranch, EventTree<E> irrelevant)
      Constructs a new Boolean event tree.
      Parameters:
      events - events whose preconditions are satisfied
      expression - the expression on which the tree will branch
      falseBranch - the branch of the tree containing events whose preconditions require the expression to be false
      trueBranch - the branch of the tree containing events whose preconditions require the expression to be true
      irrelevant - the branch of the tree containing events whose preconditions do not involve the expression

  • Method Details

    • getBranch

      public EventTree<E> getBranch(Value value)
      Description copied from class: EventTree
      Event trees branch based on the value of their expression in some state. This method is used to get the branch of the tree for which the expression has the given value. When this method is called with null as its argument, it will return the irrelevant branch if one exists. If this tree has no branches for the given value, this method returns null.
      Specified by:
      getBranch in class BranchingEventTree<E extends Event>
      Parameters:
      value - the value of the tree's expression in some state
      Returns:
      the branch corresponding to the tree's expression have that value
